channel.title: System.currentTimeMillis() tutorial

item.title: System.currentTimeMillis() tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“dragonkk, post:20, topic:535657”]im going to explain why you shouldnt us3 it… or not, google abit urself.

clock time goes wrong when server being strssed and so does system.currentmiliseconds… ye its not accurate… i learned it the hard way 1 year ago. set time in ms at begin and then use nanosecond whixh is accurate.[/quote]
You should only be using nanoseconds for precise measurements whereas milliseconds is okay for accuracy. There is no need for an rsps to be that precise.

As for that server load statement, I would blame your coding.

Read full topic

item.title: System.currentTimeMillis() tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:23, topic:535657”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=654463.msg4400191#msg4400191 date=1390426405]

[quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=654463.msg4400033#msg4400033 date=1390388405]

im going to explain why you shouldnt us3 it… or not, google abit urself.

clock time goes wrong when server being strssed and so does system.currentmiliseconds… ye its not accurate… i learned it the hard way 1 year ago. set time in ms at begin and then use nanosecond whixh is accurate.
[/quote]NEWSFLASH: nanoTime() is more accurate than currentTimeMillis()

when are you ever going to need nanosecond timing in runescape private servers? do you really think System.currentTimeMillis() being off by a few ms and which isn’t even used for actual events/tasks is going to make any difference?
[/quote]you’re quoting the wrong guy buddy[/quote]
my mistake that wasn’t directed towards you

Read full topic

item.title: System.currentTimeMillis() tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

xx matty xx:

Yeah I agree, timers are a dumb idea because they have unnecessary overhead. I’m assuming that this code is inside a server tick method, so he can simply count the ticks to work out when to perform the action. It’s no less accurate because you’re still limited to executing the action within the tick method, regardless of how you test the time. I guess one cause of inaccuracy would be if the tick method was slow.

What are you saying? This code doesn’t have to be inside a server tick method.

Read full topic

item.title: System.currentTimeMillis() tutorial
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Yeah I agree, timers are a dumb idea because they have unnecessary overhead. I’m assuming that this code is inside a server tick method, so he can simply count the ticks to work out when to perform the action. It’s no less accurate because you’re still limited to executing the action within the tick method, regardless of how you test the time. I guess one cause of inaccuracy would be if the tick method was slow.

Read full topic

item.title: System.currentTimeMillis() tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

xx matty xx:

If your server uses a tick model then it seems like a better approach, because you know the length of a tick and can just count them.

Yes but by using the task you are creating unnecessary stress on the server when if you used the system timer you would be creating no stress at all for the server…

And the system timer is more accurate because it’s based on milliseconds. What if you want to make it so an action can only be performed every 100 000 milliseconds? counting the ticks is a waste of time and would be extremely inaccurate in this scenario.

If we were talking about an action being executed after a certain amount of ticks then yes, using system timers would be retarded and that’s why anyone with a brain bigger than a peanut has a task system in their server. But we’re talking about timed action control here.

so which method is a better approach?

efficiency? system timers (less overhead)
accuracy? system timers (more accurate timing)

Read full topic

item.title: System.currentTimeMillis() tutorial
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

If your server uses a tick model then it seems like a better approach, because you know the length of a tick and can just count them. That’s how I’d do it anyway… don’t really give a shit if you prefer to use the System method.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

jummppy:

Umm isn’t this a bad way if your running your server on these?

what are you talking about? using this to control how fast actions can be performed would actually be more efficient than using a task and some sort of flag.

xx matty xx:

Yeah, it would be better to just use game tick time.

what? this doesn’t even make sense?
